required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study Investigating the Efficacy of a Mouthwash in Providing Long Term Relief From Dentinal Hypersensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study Investigating the Efficacy of a Mouthwash in Providing Long Term Relief From Dentinal Hypersensitivity

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the longitudinal efficacy of a potassium nitrate mouthwash formulation when used as an adjunct to brushing with a standard fluoride dentifrice for the relief of dentinal hypersensitivity (DH) compared to brushing with a standard fluoride dentifrice alone. This will be a single centre, eight week, randomised, examiner blind, two treatment arm, parallel design, stratified (by maximum baseline Schiff Sensitivity Score of the two selected test teeth) study in participants with at least two sensitive teeth that meet all the criteria at the Screening and Baseline visit. Participants will be assessed at Baseline, and at four and eight weeks to monitor clinical efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Schiff Sensitivity Score at Week 8
primary_outcome.description: The examiner indicated the participant's response to an evaporaitve air stimulus for each tooth using the Schiff Sensitivity Scale scored as follows - 0: Participant does not respond to air stimulation; 1: responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus; 2: Participant responds to air stimulus and requests discontinuation or moves from stimulus; 3: Participant responds to stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful, and requests discontinuation of the stimulus. A reduction in Schiff Sensitivity score is indicative of an imrpovement in sensitivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Schiff Sensitivity Score at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The examiner indicated the participant's response to an evaporaitve air stimulus for each tooth using the Schiff Sensitivity Scale scored as follows - 0: Participant does not respond to air stimulation; 1: responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus; 2: Participant responds to air stimulus and requests discontinuation or moves from stimulus; 3: Participant responds to stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful, and requests discontinuation of the stimulus. A reduction in Schiff Sensitivity score is indicative of an imrpovement in sensitivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Tactile Threshold at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The examiner assessed the response to tactile sensitivity using a Yeaple probe which allowed application of a known force to the dentin surface, starting at 10g and rising in increments of 10g until the tactile threshold or maximum force was reached. The tactile threshold for each tooth was determined by asking the subject whether the sensation caused discomfort. The pressure setting at which the subject gave two consecutive 'yes' responses was recorded as the tactile threshold. The higher the tactile threshold, the less sensitive the tooth. At baseline, the maximum force used was 20g; at all subsequent visits, it was 80g.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Tactile Threshold at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The examiner assessed the response to tactile sensitivity using a Yeaple probe which allowed application of a known force to the dentin surface, starting at 10g and rising in increments of 10g until the tactile threshold or maximum force was reached. The tactile threshold for each tooth was determined by asking the subject whether the sensation caused discomfort. The pressure setting at which the subject gave two consecutive 'yes' responses was recorded as the tactile threshold. The higher the tactile threshold, the less sensitive the tooth. At baseline, the maximum force used was 20g; at all subsequent visits, it was 80g.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Visual Rating Scale (VRS) at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated the intensity of their response to an evaporative air stimulus using a 10 point VRS scale with 1 indicating 'no pain' and 10 indicating 'Intense pain'. A reduction in the score is indicative of an improvement in sensitivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in VRS at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated the intensity of their response to an evaporative air stimulus using a 10 point VRS scale with 1 indicating 'no pain' and 10 indicating 'Intense pain'. A reduction in the score is indicative of an improvement in sensitivity.

arm_group.description: 3.0% weight by weight (w/w) potassium nitrate mouthwash with 0.02% sodium fluoride
Standard fluoride dentifrice containing 1000 ppm fluoride as sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP)

intervention.description: 3.0% w/w potassium nitrate mouthwash with 0.02% sodium fluoride
Standard fluoride dentifrice containing 1000 ppm fluoride as SMFP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants in good general health, with self-reported history of dentinal hypersensitivity lasting more than 6 months but not more than 10 years.
- Participants with minimum of 20 natural teeth.
- At screening, a minimum of four, non-adjacent teeth.
1. Teeth showing signs of facial/cervical gingival recession and/or signs of erosion or abrasion.
2. Teeth with Gingival Index score ≤1 and a clinical mobility of ≤1.
3. Teeth that are determined to be sensitive by the participant following a 1 second air blast to the cervical margin.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of chronic debilitating disease which, in the opinion of the investigator, could affect study outcomes.
- Any condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, causes dry mouth.
- Tooth with evidence of current or recent caries, or reported treatment of decay in 12 months of screening.
- In the 8 weeks prior to screening use of an oral care product indicated for the relief of DH.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The participants were recruited at a clinical site in the USA

group.title: Dentifrice Plus Oral Rinse
group.description: 3.0% weight by weight (w/w) potassium nitrate oral rinse with 0.02% sodium fluoride dentifrice

group.title: Dentifrice Alone
group.description: Dentifrice containing 1000 parts per million (ppm) fluoride as sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP)

group.title: Dentifrice Plus Oral Rinse
group.description: 3.0% weight by weight (w/w) potassium nitrate oral rinse with 0.02% sodium fluoride dentifrice

group.description: Dentifrice containing 1000 parts per million (ppm) fluoride as sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP)

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Schiff Sensitivity Score at Week 8
outcome.description: The examiner indicated the participant's response to an evaporaitve air stimulus for each tooth using the Schiff Sensitivity Scale scored as follows - 0: Participant does not respond to air stimulation; 1: responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus; 2: Participant responds to air stimulus and requests discontinuation or moves from stimulus; 3: Participant responds to stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful, and requests discontinuation of the stimulus. A reduction in Schiff Sensitivity score is indicative of an imrpovement in sensitivity.
outcome.population: The primary population for efficacy assessment was intent-to-treat (ITT) population.The ITT population comprised of participants, who were randomized, received at least one dose of study treatment and provided at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with a factor for treatment and baseline as covariate

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
